description:
FLEUR (Full-potential Linearised augmented plane wave in EURope) is a
code family for calculating groundstate as well as excited-state
properties of solids within the context of density functional theory
(DFT).

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
XBLAS is a reference implementation for extra precision BLAS. XBLAS is a
reference implementation for the dense and banded BLAS routines, along
with extended and mixed precision version. Extended precision is only
used internally; input and output arguments remain the same as in the
existing BLAS. Extra precisions is implemented as double-double (i.e.,
128-bit total, 106-bit significand). Mixed precision permits some
input/output arguments of different types (mixing real and complex) or
precisions (mixing single and double). This implementation is proof of
concept, and no attempt was made to optimize performance; performance
should be as good as straightforward but careful code written by hand.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description:
The Cray Scientific Libraries package, LibSci, is a collection of
numerical routines optimized for best performance on Cray systems.

dependencies.name: libxml2
dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
MVAPICH2-GDR is an optimized version of the MVAPICH2 MPI library for
GPU-enabled HPC and Deep Learning Applications. MVAPICH2-GDR is not
installable from source and is only available through a binary mirror.
If you do not find the binary you're looking for, send us an email at
mvapich@cse.ohio-state.edu. The binary mirror url is:
http://mvapich.cse.ohio-state.edu/download/mvapich/spack-
mirror/mvapich2-gdr/

dependencies.name: fftw-api
dependencies.description:
FFTW is a C subroutine library for computing the discrete Fourier
transform (DFT) in one or more dimensions, of arbitrary input size, and
of both real and complex data (as well as of even/odd data, i.e. the
discrete cosine/sine transforms or DCT/DST). We believe that FFTW, which
is free software, should become the FFT library of choice for most
applications.

dependencies.name: scalapack
dependencies.description:
The Cray Scientific Libraries package, LibSci, is a collection of
numerical routines optimized for best performance on Cray systems.

dependencies.name: libxc
dependencies.description:
Libxc is a library of exchange-correlation functionals for density-
functional theory.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: magma
dependencies.description:
The MAGMA project aims to develop a dense linear algebra library similar
to LAPACK but for heterogeneous/hybrid architectures, starting with
current "Multicore+GPU" systems.

dependencies.name: wannier90
dependencies.description:
Wannier90 calculates maximally-localised Wannier functions (MLWFs).
Wannier90 is released under the GNU General Public License.

dependencies.name: spfft
dependencies.description: Sparse 3D FFT library with MPI, OpenMP, CUDA and ROCm support.
